Package spec.mcrl2obj.Processes

Class TaskProcess

java.lang.Object
spec.mcrl2obj.Processes.AbstractProcess
spec.mcrl2obj.Processes.TaskProcess
public class TaskProcess
extends AbstractProcess
It is a process that represent a task in the bpmn model Is composed by three elements: - A set of input channels - A storage set - A set of output channels
Author:
S. Belluccini

    • addCondition

      public void addCondition​(java.lang.String condition, AbstractProcess iftrue, AbstractProcess iffalse)
      It add a condition (i.e. the if then else ()-> <> operator of mclr2) to the process describing this task in the following way. T = sum d:Data.i(d). ... .Task.()-> <> .o()....
      Parameters:
      condition - the clause to be checked
      iftrue - what happen if the condition is satisfied
      iffalse - what happen if the condition is not satisfied

    • addProcessBeforeTaskAction

      public void addProcessBeforeTaskAction​(AbstractProcess p)
      Adds a process before the current task action. Given P the process that we want to add it does T = T = sum d:Data.i(d). ... .P.Task.o()....
      Parameters:
      p - the abstract process to be added

    • addProcessAfterTasAction

      public void addProcessAfterTasAction​(AbstractProcess p)
      Adds a process after the current task action. Given P the process that we want to add it does T = T = sum d:Data.i(d). ... .Task.P.o()....
      Parameters:
      p - the abstract process to be added

    • removeSynAction

      public void removeSynAction()
      It removes the action that synchronize the memory of this process with the memory of its participants process before the current task action. Given P the process that we want to add it does T = T = sum d:Data.i(d). ... .Task.mem().o()... => T = T = sum d:Data.i(d). ... .Task.o()...

    • toPrint

      public org.javatuples.Pair<java.lang.String,​java.util.Set<java.lang.String>> toPrint()
      It defines how a task process is printed in a mcrl2 file. It returns a pair s.t. one the left there is the process definition of this process and on the right the process it self. Given T s.t. T = sum d:Data.i(d). ... .Task.o()... it returns: Pair
      Specified by:
      toPrint in class AbstractProcess

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      It defines how a task process should be printed. That is: T = sum d:Data.i(d). ... .Task.o()...
